name: Pillars Fund
mission: Pillars Fund amplifies the leadership, narratives, and talents of Muslims in the United States to advance opportunity and justice for all.
theoryOfChange: Pillars Fund explicitly states its mission to "amplify the leadership, narratives, and talents of Muslims in the United States to advance opportunity and justice for all." They are focused on "narrative and cultural power — tapping into a rich inheritance of Muslim storytelling to transform society." This approach is further detailed as a "long-term narrative and culture change strategy for and with the American Muslim community." Their work involves supporting nonprofit organizations and creative leaders who are building narrative and cultural power for social change, and they have initiatives like the Pillars Artist Fellowship to empower creatives to tell their own stories. This demonstrates a clear, documented program strategy linking their activities to their overarching goals and desired impact.
zakatClaimEvidence: Pillars Fund is described as a grant-making organization and Muslim community foundation focused on funding secular non-profit programs supporting American Muslims. There is no explicit mention on their website or in the provided search results that they accept zakat donations from individuals or have dedicated zakat funds. (Source: https://pillarsfund.secure.nonprofitsoapbox.com/donate-to-pillars-fund)

By maintaining a <cite id="12">board composed of 88% independent members</cite>, the organization ensures high standards of governance and objective decision-making. Furthermore, their fundraising model is lean, spending only <cite id="15">$0.15 to raise every $1</cite> according to efficiency metrics, which maximizes the impact of every sadaqah donation received.
rich_narrative.summary: Pillars Fund is a strategic grantmaking institution dedicated to <cite id="1">amplifying the talents of American Muslims</cite> through storytelling, leadership development, and cultural narrative shifts. Operating as a capacity-building organization, it seeks to <cite id="2">strengthen relations between American Muslims and the broader public</cite> by investing in creators and community leaders. In the 2023 fiscal year, the organization managed <cite id="3">$2,398,957 in total revenue</cite>, primarily driven by <cite id="4">$2,397,775 in public contributions</cite>. A hallmark of its operational model is high program efficiency, with a <cite id="5">74.3% program expense ratio</cite> reported in its latest filings, ensuring that the vast majority of resources directly fund its fellowships and grants. The organization has successfully <cite id="6">invested and leveraged $30 million</cite> to date to support its mission. Key initiatives include the <cite id="7">Pillars Artist Fellowship</cite> and specialized media labs that provide mentorship and financial support to Muslim storytellers. While the organization has seen a <cite id="8">3-year revenue CAGR of -53.4%</cite>, it maintains a very strong financial cushion with <cite id="9">20.7 months of working capital</cite> available to sustain its multi-year grant commitments. Its grantmaking is extensive, distributing <cite id="10">$2,425,000 in domestic grants</cite> to 45 different recipients in a single year, including major support for organizations like the <cite id="11">Inner City Muslim Action Network</cite>.
